p: In conclusion, 8 g showed high in vitro activity against Candida, including low fluconazole-susceptible species ( C. krusei and C. glabrata) which remain one of the main challenges in candidiasis therapy. Its mechanism of action involved a strong blockage of CYP51 and in a minor importance inhibition of PLA 2-like activity. This promising compound has low toxicity on MRC5 cells and a significant in vivo activity. Further investigations must be done to evaluate antifungal activity of 8 g and its enantiomers in in vivo models of candidiasis and against other fungi.
